document.discussion_title: Sunoco Logistics Partners L.P. (SXL) PT Raised to $36.00
document.topic_text: Tweet Sunoco Logistics Partners L.P. (NYSE:SXL) had its price objective increased by Barclays PLC from $33.00 to $36.00 in a research report report published on Tuesday morning. Barclays PLC currently has an overweight rating on the stock. Other institutional investors have recently added to or reduced their stakes in the company. ING Groep NV raised its position in Sunoco Logistics Partners L.P. by 137.0% in the second quarter. ING Groep NV now owns 6,775,032 shares of the company’s stock valued at $194,850,000 after buying an additional 3,916,189 shares in the last quarter. Kayne Anderson Capital Advisors LP raised its position in Sunoco Logistics Partners L.P. by 26.6% in the fourth quarter. Kayne Anderson Capital Advisors LP now owns 9,967,675 shares of the company’s stock valued at $256,154,000 after buying an additional 2,093,332 shares in the last quarter. Bank of Montreal Can purchased a new position in Sunoco Logistics Partners L.P. during the second quarter valued at about $50,227,000. Goldman Sachs Group Inc. raised its position in Sunoco Logistics Partners L.P. by 11.9% in the first quarter. Goldman Sachs Group Inc. now owns 16,244,587 shares of the company’s stock valued at $407,252,000 after buying an additional 1,730,151 shares in the last quarter. Finally, Center Coast Capital Advisors LP raised its position in Sunoco Logistics Partners L.P. by 18.9% in the second quarter. Center Coast Capital Advisors LP now owns 5,443,025 shares of the company’s stock valued at $156,487,000 after buying an additional 864,494 shares in the last quarter. Several other analysts also recently issued reports on the stock. Morgan Stanley assumed coverage on shares of Sunoco Logistics Partners L.P. in a research note on Monday, August 15th. They issued an equal weight rating and a $33.00 price objective for the company. Mitsubishi UFJ Financial Group downgraded shares of Sunoco Logistics Partners L.P. from an overweight rating to a neutral rating and set a $34.00 price objective for the company. in a research note on Thursday, August 4th. Citigroup Inc. downgraded shares of Sunoco Logistics Partners L.P. to a neutral rating and decreased their price target for the company from $38.00 to $34.00 in a research note on Friday, August 5th. They noted that the move was a valuation call. Zacks Investment Research downgraded shares of Sunoco Logistics Partners L.P. from a hold rating to a sell rating in a research note on Tuesday, July 5th. Finally, Jefferies Group downgraded shares of Sunoco Logistics Partners L.P. from a buy rating to a hold rating and lifted their price target for the company from $29.43 to $31.00 in a research note on Wednesday, June 8th. Two analysts have rated the stock with a sell rating, seven have assigned a hold rating and nine have given a buy rating to the company’s stock. The company currently has a consensus rating of Hold and an average price target of C$33.50. Shares of Sunoco Logistics Partners L.P. ( NYSE:SXL ) opened at 30.86 on Tuesday. The firm’s 50-day moving average price is $28.98 and its 200 day moving average price is $26.70. The stock has a market capitalization of $9.48 billion and a P/E ratio of 112.22. Sunoco Logistics Partners L.P. has a 52 week low of $15.43 and a 52 week high of $34.88. Sunoco Logistics Partners L.P. (NYSE:SXL) last announced its quarterly earnings data on Wednesday, August 3rd. The company reported $0.34 earnings per share (EPS) for the quarter, topping the Thomson Reuters’ consensus estimate of $0.12 by $0.22. During the same period in the previous year, the business earned $0.83 EPS. The firm earned $2.27 billion during the quarter, compared to the consensus estimate of $2.08 billion. The firm’s revenue for the quarter was down 29.2% on a year-over-year basis. Analysts expect that Sunoco Logistics Partners L.P. will post $0.86 earnings per share for the current year. The company also recently declared a quarterly dividend, which was paid on Friday, August 12th. Shareholders of record on Monday, August 8th were issued a $0.50 dividend. This represents a $2.00 annualized dividend and a yield of 6.48%. This is a positive change from Sunoco Logistics Partners L.P.’s previous quarterly dividend of $0.49. The ex-dividend date was Thursday, August 4th. Sunoco Logistics Partners L.P. owns and operates a logistics business. The Company is engaged in the transport, terminalling and storage of crude oil, refined products and natural gas liquids (NGLs). The Company’s segments include Crude Oil, Natural Gas Liquids and Refined Products. In addition to logistics services, it also owns acquisition and marketing assets, which are used to facilitate the purchase and sale of crude oil, refined products and NGLs. Sunoco Logistics Partners L.P. Sunoco Logistics Partners L.P.
